reviewText: Set in 1940, THE ONLY WAY is the story of a Jewish family's attempt to flee Denmark before the German Army occupies the country. This low-key movie was a co-operative effort of four nations.Historical note: Danes refused to turn Jews over to the occupying Germans, and some 7,000 were eventually provided safe passage to Sweden."The Only Way" is also available onDVD.Also recommended:THE ARYAN COUPLE(2004) is the story of a Jewish industrialist who must turn over his business to Hitler's government in order to secure for his family safe passage from the country. Stars Martin Landau as Joseph Krauzenberg.  (DVD only)Parenthetical number preceding title is a 1 to 10 IMDb viewer poll rating.(6.3) The Only Way (USA/Denmark/Panama/UK-1970) - Ebbe Rode/Helle Virkner/Jane Seymour/Ove Sproge/Martin Potter/Benny Hansen/Kjeld Nrgaard/Bendt Rothe/Kjeld Jacobsen/Claus Nissen/Erik Kühnau/Bjrn Watt-Boolsen
summary: During WWII, honorable people save innocent lives

reviewText: Like the movieHidden in Silence, this is an intense recounting of a true story about the incredible and heroic effort by the Danish people to save their Jewish neighbors & populace from Nazi persecution and the holocaust. Jane Seymour plays a key role in this with great acting. It is very real, well done and well worth it! It tells a little known part of the Nazi conquests and heroism that could only have been the result of true love of neighbor!This movie also gives an idea of how extensive the Nazi grasp was during WWII by giving us a look at the Nazi occupation in Denmark, so often not even mentioned in this regard.
summary: A look at Love & Goodness--the "giving" they entail--the "heroism" they produce.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Great story of the Danish jews escape plan from the Nazis in WWII. This is a powerful movie that is affordable and it's nice to see in light of the 'Criterion" movies such as "The Sorrow and the Pity", The Battle of Algiers", "Army of Shadows", and also "Danish Solution", all of them excellent in their own right but rather pricey. Pick this one up if you're interested in escape/resistance themed war stories.
summary: A great story that most can afford.

reviewText: This is not the best movie made about the holocaust but it interesting to see how one nation(Denmark)stood side by side with their Jewish population and their bravery to help hide and send them away to safety when the Nazis tried to arrest and send their citizens to the Nazis death camps. I was very suprised that the movie didn't have more to it especially with the wonderful actress, Jane Seymour who did a fantastic job playing Natalie Jastrow Henry, a Jewish person in the great movie War and Rememberence filmed some 15 or 18 years later. Perhaps The Only Way was edited and much stripped from the movie after the first viewing. The Danes are true heroes for standing up to the Nazis and doing all they could to protect their neigbors and friends.

reviewText: This story lacks tension. The father of the fleeing family is an idiot. First, he refuses to leave when he has the chance. Then, he insists on going out to get/sell his pricey violin when the risk is WAY too high. THEN, after 3 taxis, 2 trains and a boat...the MORON forgets to take his violin onto the escape boat. After almost having his family captured TWICE...his friend and his wife should have killed the feeb and saved them the bother he caused everyone. The only sad part is the idiot had a daughter and had already passed his genes to the next generation.

reviewText: I am reading Countrymen (Bo Lidegaard), so wanted to see dramatization.  Family in film had a very dedicated friend, probably most Danish Jews did not.  Also, they never paid for their ship passage.  In fact, the crossing was very expensive.  Film exaggerates heroism, doesn't depict essential character of Danish culture accurately, I think.  I would like to see more development of interpersonal relations in a movie.  Don't think the rescue effort was as well organized as film represents.
summary: Conveys insensitivity in Danish society to Jewish Nazi threat (& consequent shock) well

reviewText: It was a nice way to learn how Denmark fared in ww2.  I learned some history from this video and the acting was good.  Denmark's experience could have been a lot worse but these people showed bravery and it was not as brutal to watch as some of the ww2 movies have been.

reviewText: A beautiful movie of fear and persecution, love, family, community, courage, patriotism and deliverance.After the German occupation of Denmark began in 1940 the Danes made their surrender to the Nazis conditional on a promise that the Jews of Denmark would not be deported or harmed. However true to his tradition  of breaking agreements On October 1, 1943 Nazi leader Adolf Hitler ordered Danish Jews to be arrested and deported. Despite great personal risk, the Danish resistance movement with the assistance of many ordinary Danish citizens took part in a collective effort to evacuate about 7,800 Jews of Denmark by sea to nearby neutral Sweden.Many brave Danish people did all they could to help the beleaguered Jews.This movie focuses on a fictional Danish Jewish family which must have resembled many real families at the time. And their efforts to escape Denmark with the aid of Danish friends.Starring a gorgeous 19 year old Jane Seymour as a beautiful, intelligent and talented Jewish young lady , Lilian Stein, and Ebbe Rode and Helle Virkner as her parents. It is Seymour's brilliant acting that is one of the main attractions of this movie. Martin Potter is also excellent in his role as the Danish hero who in instrumental in helping the family escape.While it is true that the movie is not as violent as most Holocaust movies, the fear is there, the Danish resistance to the demonic evil of the Nazis, the pathos of the time, a tortuous time for the Jewish people- (example we see a pretty half-Jewish child having to leave the ballet lesson Lillian is giving due to the Nazi order for all Jewish children in Denmark to leave schools).  And the gripping final scenes of the escape with the Nazis in hot pursuit and the attack on the pursuing Nazi convoy by the Danish resistance fighters.Highly recommended as a movie to introduce young people to the Holocuast

reviewText: Hemisphere Pictures presents "THE ONLY WAY" (1970)(86 min/Color) (Dolby digitally remastered) --- Director Bent Christensen has given us a lasting story with great direction --- Wonderful cast with outstanding acting on all accounts --- Take note of the Art and Set decoration and Original Music Score ---  A superior film detailing the heroism of the Danish Christians in the face of the enemy --- Entire cast performs brilliantly making this a not to be missed film --- Based on true events in the telling about the Danes helping to save their Jewish population from the Nazi concentration camps.Under the Production Staff of:Bent Christensen [Director & Screenwriter]John Gould  [Screenwriter]Leif Panduro  [Story]Barry Levinson [Producer]Mogens Skot-Hansen [Executive Producer]Carl Davis [Original Score]Henning Kristiansen [Cinematographer]Norman Wanstall  [Film Editor]BIOS:1. Jane SeymourDate of Birth:  15 February 1951 - Hayes, Hayes and Harlington, Middlesex, England, UKDate of Death:  Still Living2.  Bent Christensen  [Director]Date of Birth:  28 May 1929 - Gunderup, DenmarkDate of Death:  6 January 1992 - Kelderns, Denmarkthe cast includes:Jane Seymour ...  Lillian SteinEbbe Rode ...  Leo SteinHelle Virkner ...  Ruth SteinOve Sproge ...  Mr. PetersenMartin Potter ...  Morten JensenBenny Hansen ...  LarsKjeld Nrgaard ...  ReimanBendt Rothe ...  SandersKjeld Jacobsen ... MogensThis is worth a view, first time on DVD --- There are trailers of coming attractions in this set --- The VCI release is very clean, crisp and of high quality digitally remastered and restored --- This is one of the greatest escape stories in history, if it were fiction you wouldn't believe it --- But it did happen.Total Time: 86 min on DVD ~ VCI Entertainment #8560 ~ (7/27/2010)

reviewText: I was not familiar of this true story of how the people of Denmark protected and saved almost all of the 8,000 Jews with only a 24hr notice. They had made a pact with Hitler that while they were under German control the Jews would be left alone. Well this holds for only 3yrs as we know Hitler was not to be trusted and we know what he did with the Jews. The people of Denmark were so brave and acted as one!It is quite moving. Not as violent as most holocaust accounts. A good introduction for older children. I love stores of how people helped people in WWII taking no thought to the fact they would die also if caught, they just did what was right. This is a film everyone should see.We must never forget this time in history.
summary: A very young Jane Seymour in a true tale of love and courage.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I'm not sure how factual this movie is but it does a good job portraying the Danish who like some of the Dutch, were willing to do what they could to help out as many jews as they could. It was nice to see a very young Jane Seymour. It starts out with her family being told to leave by morning before the jewish round up that is coming the next morning. A family friend and non jew helps the family make it across to Sweden but not without help from other Danes. Most of the movie the family is going from one place to another without ever being completely safe. it's quite a journey for the family and for all the people along the way who do what they can.
summary: it's a movie for a rainy day

reviewText: I liked this Film, but it ended too soon. In fact I was astounded at the Final end.Would have liked to have had a story of what happened to these people who escaped?
